,TRUE,5,4,2,5,4 Odeinoichus","2017-09-10T21:45:59.967Z","Bat Shark Repellant!","

Set #71017 Dick Grayson: No crazy costumes, just ordinary Dick Grayson before he takes on the mantle of Robin, and a pretty decent figure to get from this CMF Series, seeing as how he was not offered in any sets.

Dick has double-sided printing on his torso for his red sweater, his pants are plain and unadorned save for the belt and pockets, overall this is a pretty decent Minifigure for casual clothes and multiples will grant you a lot of parts to use for your own creations. his hair piece is wild looking and very fun, the big bottle-lense glasses make his eyes look very big and his included accessory is an iconic piece of Batman history. The Shark Repellant Bat-Spray was used to great effect in the first Batman motion picture from the 1960'

column2: d recommend tracking this character down, mostly for parts, but also because he isn&#39
column3: t found in any of the sets in this outfit.

column1: Duck Grayson is a character who rarely appears out of his robin alter ego and this figure is perfect .

The figure has a dual moulded hair glasses combo with printed eyes , a very happy smiling face print , a useful jumper print with a you guessed it robin pattern and some great printed legs showing jeans with a belt .
His accessory is great as it is shark repellent from the 60s batman show spin off movie '
column4: in 1966 it has all of the appropriate prints and is amazing . The stand is the standard black CMF stand .

column1: this may be my favourite of this series but I still feel as if there is much to love for the non batman nerds ( although I am definitely on the opposing side #batmanisthebesthero ) with the torso and legs respectable prints so I recommend it to all .
